# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt, bump = 3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ArgumentError("Function supports DateTime inputs only.")))
    end

    return dt + Hour(bump)
end
```
This function `timezone_bumper` accepts a timestamp (`dt`) and an optional integer `bump` (default is 3). It first checks if the provided timestamp is of type `Date`. If it is, the function throws an error. Otherwise, it adds `bump` hours to the input timestamp and returns the updated value.
